_header: As I wandered here by west / Fast under a forest side
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 198.
_description: ‘Ay Merci God and Graunt Merci’ — twelve 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc), alliterative, including refrain, ‘With marcy Lorde & gramarcy’ or ‘mercy god and graunt merci’

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
AS I wandrede her bi westeffaste vnder a fforest
                    syde…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…þi swete face þat we may seNou Merci God And Graunt
                    Merci

NLS1931.First Lines:
As I wandurd here be westeffast vndur A forest
                    syde…
NLS1931.Last Lines:
…All myȝty god haffe mercy on meÞat forr my synne
                    þi blode dyd schede
NLS1931.Note:
Lines 1-12 only; 2441
                    follows immediately as if part of same work; not Advocates’ 19.31.1 as in
                        Brown  and  Robbins (1943)
